db:abstract.db:para: The QGraphicsDropShadowEffect class provides a drop shadow effect.
This class was introduced in Qt 4.6.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: A drop shadow effect renders the source with a drop shadow. The color of the drop shadow can be modified using the setColor() function. The drop shadow offset can be modified using the setOffset() function and the blur radius of the drop shadow can be changed with the setBlurRadius() function.

By default, the drop shadow is a semi-transparent dark gray (QColor(63, 63, 63, 180)) shadow, blurred with a radius of 1 at an offset of 8 pixels towards the lower right. The drop shadow offset is specified in device coordinates.

db:section.db:title: QGraphicsDropShadowEffect::QGraphicsDropShadowEffect(QObject *parent = 0)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new QGraphicsDropShadowEffect instance. The parent parameter is passed to QGraphicsEffect's constructor.

db:section.db:title: void QGraphicsDropShadowEffect::blurRadiusChanged(qreal blurRadius)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the effect's blur radius changes. The blurRadius parameter holds the effect's new blur radius.

db:section.db:title: void QGraphicsDropShadowEffect::colorChanged(const QColor &color)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the effect's color changes. The color parameter holds the effect's new color.

db:section.db:title: void QGraphicsDropShadowEffect::offsetChanged(const QPointF &offset)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted whenever the effect's shadow offset changes. The offset parameter holds the effect's new shadow offset.
